attributes.action: Hold a General Election if there is no deal on Brexit by September 2018
attributes.background: Leaving the EU without an agreement on our future relationship would be catastrophic in economic and human terms. If the government cannot deliver, our sovereign Parliament should be allowed to implement alternative arrangements, including dissolution and a General Election, to avoid this outcome.
attributes.additional_details: When people voted leave in the EU Referendum, there was no suggestion that we would choose to, or have to, leave without a deal. The government has not made any practical preparations for a no deal scenario, and  negotiations are not progressing fast enough. If the government cannot deliver, Parliament should take over and use whatever means necessary to avoid a no deal scenario. As this will involve a loss of confidence in the current government, a General Election should be held.

attributes.action: Keep the iconic burgundy British passport
attributes.background: The government has stated its intention to change UK passports from red to blue. This needless colour change would bring no benefits. Since no under-40 ever possessed a blue passport, a change would mean little except to a shrinking minority. To young people, the red passport is the iconic one.
attributes.additional_details:
Changing the colour would be a backwards step for a country that seeks, in the words of the Prime Minister, to be a forward-looking nation with a 'dynamic, creative spirit'.

It is also unclear why, since we are exiting the EU, we would want to change passports from the current patriotic red to the colours of the EU flag. Since EU member states are allowed any colour of passport they like, changing would be no great statement of sovereignty, as some have suggested.

While frivolous petitions are quite rightfully rejected, passport colour is of serious concern to many around the country. As the Immigration Minister says: “One of the most iconic things about being British is having a British passport.” I trust, therefore, that this petition will be treated with the seriousness it merits.

attributes.action: Introduce specialist juries for rape trials, not random jurors
attributes.background: Specialist juries who understand how complex and serious rape is could prevent mistrials and mean that more rapists are found guilty. They should be introduced in rape cases to protect victims and make sure rapists go to prison.
attributes.additional_details:
A rape trial case went for retrial as a juror got arrested with drugs. Second jury chose to help defendant and defendants' barrister was more prepared.

Victim had ribs broken. She had been controlled, bullied and traumatised. She had to go through two rape trials. Defendant had no witnesses in original trial, but had four in last trial. Victim was bullied in court by barrister. It was horrific, not justice.

attributes.action: Raise at the UN Security Council the  police violence against the Catalan people
attributes.background: The widespread police violence against civilians trying to hold a referendum vote today is an insult to democracy in Western Europe and requires a proper UK response. We have a Responsibility To Protect where a state allows its own people to be treated like this

attributes.action: To introduce an annual dementia screening test for everyone over the age of 45.
attributes.background: Dementia is the major cause of death in England and Wales and, due to the aging population and more awareness of this disease, is set to become the UK's biggest killer. Earlier diagnosis and treatment can slow down the disease and help to improve the sufferer's quality of life.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/info/20056/our_care_and_cure_research_magazine/971/dementia_research_news_-_spring_2017/4

attributes.action: Life skills should be compulsory education from the age of 5 yrs to 18 yrs
attributes.background: Young adults don't have the life skill required to become a valued member of the community, they need to understand how our society works, tax, social services and amenities, having an enormous financial cost to our society,they also do not understand relationships, social responsibly and parenting
attributes.additional_details:
I have found that many young people become adults, not having a basic understanding of how our society functions, they don't know about the tax system, how the welfare state works or is funded, they don't understand social responsibly, 
This proposal would give a child 13 years of education on how relationships work ,respecting other, parenting skills, budgeting skill, becoming part of the community and understanding that responsibility.
It would also help understand social responsibility

attributes.action: Mental Health Education and coping strategies to be taught in schools
attributes.background: Let's look to prevention rather than cure and enable young people with awareness skills and coping strategies taught in schools so as to enable them to not feel so helpless when faced with depression, anxiety and the like further in life.

attributes.action: Strict Law on purchase of Acid
attributes.background: Increase in number of acid attacks everyday. It is very disappointing to know the easy availability of acid. It is not the face or body they destroy, they destroy the whole life of the victims. Acid should only be available to license holders.
attributes.additional_details: Acid attacks in London are increasing everyday. People have started attacking in groups now. It is very scary to walk in the street of London. It has to stop now! Acid should only be available to license holders and strict law should be enforced on each and every purchase of the substance. Lets make London a terror free place to live again!!

attributes.action: Change Ofsted's investigation visits from scheduled to unannounced
attributes.background:
Due to a recent incident involving my child's nursery it has come to my attention that Ofsted give notice of an inspection to schools and nurseries. 
When it comes to the welfare of our children scheduled visits is not the most accurate way of obtaining information about a childcare provider

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public&private holiday services to be under an ombudsman
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for providers of holidays whether it be a public or private service,to be under an ombudsman. This allows there to be a fair and impartial assessment of dispute cases to stop those acting independently from treating customers unfairly when they are not willing to negotiate.

attributes.action: Make the provision of seat belts on ALL school transport compulsory
attributes.background: My son's school bus has been involved in 2 collisions in the space of 10 months.  On both occasions the school bus had no seat belts.  We want the law changed before there is a serious injury or death.  Allowing local councils to determine the transport specification leaves children at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The legislation in Wales has been changed to make seat belts in school transport compulsory, Scotland are currently petitioning government and are at stage 3 of the process (financial considerations).  It is totally unthinkable that children in England are being left at risk.

attributes.action: Require Petrol Stations and Airports to have free filtered Water Fountains.
attributes.background:
The goverment should mandate all Petrol Stations and Airports to provide the public with free, clean, filtered Water Fountatins.

Anybody could then refill their reusable water bottles for free.

This would dramatically cut down the amount of plastic bottles that are destroying our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Let's fight plastic waste at the source.  By providing the public with a safe and easy alternative.

When travelling it's easy to be caught short without enough water to get through the day, forcing many people to buy bottled water.  Let's change that.

Furthermore at airports we are not allowed to take our own water through security. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/travel/2017/07/revealed-no-water-fountains-in-more-than-half-of-uk-international-airports-

attributes.action: Make NHS prescriptions and healthcare free for all Universal Credit claimants
attributes.background: Universal Credit claimants are being denied the free prescriptions and NHS dental care they are entitled to because doctors and dentists don't know whether they are eligible for it. Claimants for some of the benefits included in Universal Credit are entitled to free healthcare while others aren't.
attributes.additional_details:
This government’s incompetent handling of the move to Universal Credit is leaving many people already struggling with their finances, including people legally entitled to free dental care and prescriptions, going without the treatment they need because they can't afford to pay for it.

No one in Britain should have to go without healthcare because they can't afford it. Prescriptions and all NHS treatment should be free to anyone claiming Universal Credit. More information at http://bit.ly/2yzForA

attributes.action: Enforce a maximum limit on vehicle insurance prices for young people.
attributes.background: Insurance prices in this modern day are through the roof. And its even worse for young drivers. I know there is more of a chance of us crashing due to lack of experience however we still need to get to work and function as a part of society.
attributes.additional_details: My first year car insurance was £1600 on a Ford Ka. Paid in monthly instalments. Unfortunately I crashed in my first year due to a spillage on the road during a wet day. Unavoidable. I was following the speed limit, no one else was involved. But my insurance is due to rise to upwards of £3000 in January. I am 19 and well paid for my age but still this is going to be a struggle. I know many people who also struggle with this however first year drivers older than 24 pay less, how does that work?

attributes.action: Withdraw the UK from the European Convention on Human Rights
attributes.background: We need to restore common sense to our country. It is time to put Britain first. We need a British Bill of Rights and Responsibilities. The formal link between the British Courts and the European Court of Human Rights needs to be broken.
attributes.additional_details: The Supreme Court should be the ultimate arbiter of human rights matters in the UK

attributes.action: Compulsory liability insurance for dog owners, criminal offence to leave scene
attributes.background:
It is law if you damage someone's property they are entitled to compensation. 
If my dog is attacked by another dog then it's owner should pay my vet bills. It should be a criminal offence for them not to give their details. The incident/history should then be reported/recorded to authorities/vets.
attributes.additional_details:
Records of how many times dog has attacked. The owner should be made to take dog to behavioural or correction training or the dog would need to be controlled on lead or muzzled in public. 
Medical insurance should be owners choice but insurance to cover your dog attacking another dog/person compulsory. It protects both parties from expensive vet/claim costs. 
We have compulsory car insurance. Dogs feel pain, trauma and so does the owner seeing their pet attacked.
Please support.

attributes.action: Christmas items must not be advertised, stocked or displayed before December
attributes.background: It should be law for any businesses not to advertise, stock or sell any Christmas related items
attributes.additional_details: It is currently September and we can see Christmas items before Halloween items or Firework items

attributes.action: Prevent the media from naming alleged sex offenders, unless they are convicted
attributes.background:
The media publish the names, photos, and other details of alleged sex offenders during their trials.  Their future life is ruined regardless of the outcome while the alleged victim gets lifelong anonymity.

We believe this is unfair and the accused's identity should be protected unless convicted.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ibblaw.co.uk/insights/blog/man-cleared-rape-urges-anonymity-accused (24th March 2017)

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/footballer-ched-evans-cleared-rape-12026611 (14th October 2016)

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4909300/Former-student-accused-rape-female-friend-cleared.html (22nd September 2017)

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4909872/University-Challenge-student-CLEARED-rape.html (a separate case also from 22nd September 2017)

attributes.action: Make it illegal to spit in the street/road. You should be fined if you do so.
attributes.background: So I have seen a lot of people spit in public on the road or pavement. It is honestly disgusting. They should be fined. Countless times I've seen this, especially in the Hayes area. You should be fined if you are caught by doing this. This rule should everywhere.
attributes.additional_details:
Places like have banned this: Enfield, Central London, Waltham Forest Council.

Sources:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-25291274
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2430724/Fined-160-spitting-street-First-prosecutions-councils-tough-littering-laws.html
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/people-who-spit-in-the-street-in-london-face-80-fine-9912228.html

attributes.action: Make March 29th Brexit Bank Holiday
attributes.background: Celebrate our EU exit

attributes.action: To create correct training for police who investigate rape allegations.
attributes.background:
Too many rape victims have been let down by our justice system. They themselves are made to feel like it was their fault, or they were in the wrong. 
This is not right. Do victims of theft find themselves being treated the same way?
attributes.additional_details:
70% Of women will not report a rape. 
Conviction rates for rape are far lower than other crimes, with only 5.7% of reported rape cases ending in a conviction for the perpetrator.
Correct training needs to be provided for police officers who investigate rape allegations, so these victims can be treated with respect, listened to and helped.

attributes.action: Let all UK citizens vote on who is mayor of London not just Londoners.
attributes.background: London being the capital city, all uk citizens should have a say who becomes mayor.
attributes.additional_details:
The whole of the uk should be allowed to vote on who becomes mayor of our capital city, as what happens in London also effect the outer towns and city's, 
So voting should be changed, so people living outside London can have their say through a vote who they would like to see become mayor of London.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to define a dangerous dog based on characteristics.
attributes.background: This petition calls on the new government to amend the Dangerous Dogs Act to remove breed specific legislation and define a dog as dangerous based entirely on its behaviour.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of dogs each year are seized under breed specific legislation, based on how they look and put away in kennels, away from their owner for months to be assessed as to whether or not they are dangerous.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for UK Councils to provide recycling bins in all public areas
attributes.background: Recycling is a small but pivotal source of reform to our behaviours that can have a big impact on reducing the effects of global warming. The Government should not only support but enforce measures to reduce our carbon footprint by making recycling points commonplace around UK high streets and parks

attributes.action: Allow Special Constables the ability to be awarded the QPM outside of Scotland.
attributes.background: Formed in 1831 the Special Constabulary pre-dates the modern police service as a voluntary police service in the United Kingdom, in modern times the Special Constabulary patrol side by side with paid Police Officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details: The Queens Police Medal which can be awarded to Police Officers for distinguished service, currently however it is only in Scotland that Specials are eligible to be nominated for this award, this petition seeks to address this in-balance and permit voluntary police officers throughout the whole of the United Kingdom the same right in their eligibility for the QPM award.  The Special Constabulary give tens of thousands of hours to the protecting our communities each year as vital part of policing

attributes.action: Charge for Missed NHS Appointments
attributes.background:
Whatever we think about our NHS, it is there for us all, day and night. But it is in trouble and something has to change. 
If we don’t respect it, we will lose it.  
£300 million pounds are lost in Missed Appointments. Charging for these would reduce DNA’s and create income.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent government survey showed 10 million GP Appointments are missed every year. 
This equates to £300 million pounds. 
If a £20 charge was made £200 million could be saved and the privilege of getting an appointment would be more respected. 
More Appointments would either be kept or would incur a no show cancellation charge as it in the private sector. If we do nothing to save our NHS, nothing will change. Please sign and share.

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pellet guns to under 21's and require licensing.
attributes.background: Our country's gun laws are one of the toughest yet we still sell low-powered air guns to anyone over 18 without requiring a license.
attributes.additional_details: Every day animals are being shot at and harmed or killed by heartless individuals who see them as target practice. People are also being injured by these dangerous weapons. We need stricter control now, especially in this time of increasing gun crime. It is only a matter of time before their use becomes even more wide spread.

attributes.action: Give all National Health workers free parking and free public transport.
attributes.background: for the last seven years National Health workers have had a pay freeze. But are still expected to pay parking fees to park at work which can be anything up to 10% of their wages, by giving them all free parking and free public transport.This would be like giving them a 5-6% pay rise

attributes.action: Make it law for all UK citizens to carry a identity card.
attributes.background: Carrying identity cards would help to prevent non UK residents using our NHS without paying for the service, and also stop people getting benefits when they are not entitled.

attributes.action: Require schools to teach year five and above about LGBT and how it’s positive.
attributes.background: It is important that children know about gay and transgender people as someone they know could be gay/trans or some might be gay/trans themselves.
attributes.additional_details: I got lots of abuse when I came out as gay because the people I was around did not know much on the subject. I also know many people who experienced this kind of abuse.

attributes.action: Ban Transfat in food production
attributes.background: The Partially Hydrogenated Oil family (PHO's) are a common food additive known to cause high Cholesterol, a condition which can cause stroke and heart attack. They have been banned from food production in several countries including America from 2018 and we are calling for a UK ban.
attributes.additional_details: PHO's are a Transfat. You will find them listed on the ingredients of most processed food including bread and pastry products under these names E471, E472, Mono and di-glycerides of fatty acids Hydrogenated or Partially Hydrogenated fats. The British Heart Foundation says: “Avoid wherever possible. They can increase cholesterol in your blood." Heart disease and stroke, to which high cholesterol contributes, are ranked in the top 5 most common killers only beaten to the number 1 spot by cancer.

attributes.action: Make primary schools allow kids toilet breaks during class time
attributes.background: My son has ongoing trouble with faecal impaction.  If he can't go to the loo he can become blocked and then be unwell/vomiting for a week. This will mean a 5 minute toilet visit being refused will cost him 5 days approx absence and this will result in us receiving snotty letters for attendance.

attributes.action: Make dentistry free at the point of delivery for all and fees payable later
attributes.background: The NHS dental services in England are a shambles. There is no free at the point of delivery service for patients in need of treatment who don't fall into the low earnings category. I am petitioning to make all UK NHS dentistry free at point of delivery giving everyone a chance to access it.
attributes.additional_details:
Payment would then be made at a later date. It would mean no one would have to suffer. We don't fall into the low income bracket but we also cannot afford dentistry on the spot. My practice doesn't even do emergency slots. I'm sat here with a hole in one of my molars, the pain of the exposed nerve is worse than childbirth yet there's no way I'll be able to get treatment within the next month.
The whole point of paying national insurance and tax is to guarantee our healthcare!

attributes.action: Give free IVF and egg harvesting to endometriosis sufferers
attributes.background: I have been suffering with endometriosis for 15 years only diagnosed for 3 years, I will be having a hysterectomy and found out from my doctor that if I want my eggs harvested I will have to pay for it, this can cost £5000+ this should be offered on the NHS.

attributes.action: Make 'Up To' internet package speeds illegal.
attributes.background: 'Up To' internet speed packages plague the UK market and are used as an instant 'get out of jail free card' if the companies oversell or over promise on what customers are expecting. Customers are not able to accurately compare speeds and often receive much lower than is stated.
attributes.additional_details:
Internet packages are often sold as 'Up To' speeds. A package 'Up to 100MBps' may in fact regularly provide 8MBps (8% of the expected speed). The Government should either: 
A) Require the speed received to be no less than 80% of the speed advertised, (example "100MBps", min acceptable 80MBps) 
Or 
B) Force companies to sell at the minimal acceptable speed, (example "From 80MBps"). 
If the speed paid for is not met for more than 1 hour the customer should not have to pay for that days costs.

attributes.action: Suspend the ambassador of Myanmar for his country's action against the Rohingya.
attributes.background: Awful reports are coming out of Myanmar about atrocities against the Rohingya muslim minority. The government of Myanmar refuses to help as they deny that the Rohingya are citizens of their country.
attributes.additional_details: There are several BBC articles explaining the situation, which you can find on their website.

attributes.action: A Carbon Tax For Companies Producing over a certain amount of green house gases
attributes.background: The UK Government has set very ambitious Carbon cut goals, so in order to ensure that these goals are reached or even exceeded, a price on greenhouse gases emitted over a certain amount (of C02e) should be instated. This would help reduce the emissions of factories and companies in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: With Wind power becoming cheaper than nuclear and hydroelectric looking like the future of energy, companies should be looking to more sustainable energy sources to not only help improve the environment but to improve their revenue.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to label non-racist people as racist.
attributes.background: I am tired of non-racist people being called racist and groups against terrorism being labelled as racist.  Racism is justifiably a serious offence and calling people racist when it's unjust and untrue should be considered just as serious an offence.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for 2 people to travel on a Moped.
attributes.background:
I want to change the law to stop 2 people travelling on a Moped. 
The reason for this is to stop Criminal Offences including Acid attacks, Mobile phone snatching, Handbag snatching etc...
This will not affect Motorbike riders.
attributes.additional_details:
As we have seen on the News headlines these crimes are often carried out by 2 people on a Moped where the passenger is spraying Acid or snatching personal items from pedestrians. This will allow the Police to stop, search and charge these criminals before they commit these serious offences.
This Law will not affect Motorbike riders who are generally older and using Motorbikes for genuine travelling.

attributes.action: Set the National living wage for all who work not just 25
attributes.background: Help more people into work and a fair pay living wage

attributes.action: Ban protesters from wearing facial coverings during demonstrations.
attributes.background: With the rise of Antifa, Right / Left wing demonstrations and violence, the hiding of faces to thwart identification of those who have committed criminal offences has become very prevalent it is a hinderance to later detection and a detriment to security.

attributes.action: Abolish stamp duty for first time buyers
attributes.background: For the government to recognise the great difficulty experienced by first time buyers to find thousands of pounds of stamp duty while also having to raise very large deposits in order to get on the property ladder and therefore for the government to alleviate this expense by waiving SDLT for FTBs.

attributes.action: Create a new minimum wage called the Qualified minimum wage.
attributes.background: When a person is trained or qualified to do a job, they should automatically qualify for the qualified minimum wage (in line with the age group)  which is a higher rate to recognise the skill.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand that at the moment there is no national recognised wage for a qualified person. Therefore there is no incentive to invest in training or learning a trade. 
Weather you are a nurse, plumber, driver, dental nurse or brick layer. Skills should be recognised.

attributes.action: Void properties classed as dwelling or accommodation to be rented out or sold on
attributes.background: There are numerous properties across the UK that are owned but are classed by the local council as 'void' meaning empty.  Most of these properties would make good homes for local people who wish to either rent of buy.  There should be a maximum period where they remain empty, ie no more than 2 years
attributes.additional_details: Currently councils allow owners of void properties to pay double council tax in order  to remain empty for an indefinite period. Surely as there is a housing crisis and also a demand for social housing - most people cannot afford to buy - owners should not be allowed to sit on empty dwellings, whereby the purpose of the building is to be lived in? There should be a scheme for them to at least rent, as this would also provided much needed housing  also stop the building falling into disrepair.

attributes.action: To facilitate doctors entry into the Obs & Gyn training at ST3+ level
attributes.background: Non trainee doctors, contribute significantly to the provision of healthcare in the NHS. They are often overlooked when it comes to training opportunities, therefore unable to progress in their careers and are left disillusioned, frustrated and disappointed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently many specialities allow entry to the training at middle grade (ST3+level) except in speciality of Obstetrics and Gynaecology, which only allows entry at ST1 level.
Although there is a noticeable dropout rate of 40% of the trainees from ST1 level onwards, which impacts on the middle grade rota, as there is no recruitment for the trainees at this level, this has created significant difficulties in providing safe Obs and Gyn services. We request that the RCOG and Department of Health to create ST3+ level entry for training in Obs and Gyn . This will help to cover the middle grade rota gaps thus ensuring safe obstetric service in UK and allow  Non training grade doctors to fulfil their career ambitions. Overall, this will prevent the loss of highly skilled doctors from the NHS.

attributes.action: Pay teachers for the the time they spend on placements in schools
attributes.background: Trainee teachers are required to spend significant time working in  schools without pay. They are relied on as full members of staff and should be entitled to at least minimum wage. Due to this commitment, they are unable to hold another job and often live on a loan of around £4,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: The government offers bursaries for secondary school positions for those in certain areas or with certain qualifications. Working full time in a school severely limits the trainees to gain a secondary job to provide supplementary income. Primary trainees are eligible for student finance, which provides a very limited income and has to be repaid. Their service to a career path so important for our next generations deserves at least minimum wage. Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Make the Union Jack a standard part of all public service uniforms & vehicles.
attributes.background: Our Police, Fire Brigade, Border Agency and other emergency and public services embody the very best of British and work hard to secure and protect the British public.
attributes.additional_details:
The Union Jack is already internationally recognised as a beacon of democracy, rule of law and freedom.

A country's flag is present on the public service uniforms and vehicles of many countries such as the USA, Spain and New Zealand but not ours.

With Brexit on the horizon, our national flag should become a standard element as part of our services' uniforms and vehicles to show the world our pride in queen, country, our country's values and the people whom they represent.

attributes.action: NHS need to invest more money in Adult Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals.
attributes.background: Mental Health and Psychiatric hospitals
attributes.additional_details: The NHS do not provide adequate staff and there are very few things to do on Adult Psychiatric wards. Staff need to be trained properly to deal with situations they do not know how to. There needs to be more distractions and activities to do and more staffing to ensure there are people to talk to when needed.

attributes.action: fitting of dash cams in vehicles to be mandatory
attributes.background: If this were a legal requirement in accidents where there are no witnesses it could provide vital information for the police and families, shorten investigation times therefore saving money & resources and act as a deterrent for reckless behaviour
